Article.ArticleTitle: Derivation of Mount Pinatubo stratospheric aerosol mean size distribution by means of a multiwavelength lidar.

AbstractText: A multiwavelength lidar operated in Sodankyla, Finland, during the European Arctic Stratospheric Ozone Experiment (December 1991-March 1992). It produced vertical profiles of stratospheric aerosols at four wavelengths. The determination of aerosol mean size distribution has been performed by use of extinction/backscattering ratios as obtained from lidar data processing at 355, 352, and 750 nm. Lognormal distributions of sulfuric particles with mode radius of r(m) = 0.12-0.25 µm and corresponding widths of s = 2-1.6 have been retrieved as best fits of experimental data, in good agreement with in situ measurements. A successful attempt to derive bimodal log-normal distributions is also described, together with the experimental and theoretical problems involved.
